Receipt for 1845 Illinois and Sangamon County Taxes, 1 Received ofAbraham Lincolnhis State and county tax, for the year 1845 Valuation real estate. $1500Valuation personal property $300Tax,

$11.40
paragraphs: Receipt for 1845 Illinois and Sangamon County Taxes, 1 Received ofAbraham Lincolnhis State and county tax, for the year 1845 Valuation real estate. $1500Valuation personal property $300Tax,
citations: Deed of Charles Dresser and Louisa W. Dresser to Abraham Lincoln.
Deed of Elijah Iles and Malinda Iles to Abraham Lincoln.

footnotes.text:
1William Harvey filled in the blanks of this partially-printed form and signed the
                  document.

2This property was Abraham Lincolnâ€™s home at Eighth  and Jackson streets inSpringfield, which he purchased fromCharles Dresserin 1844.Deed of Charles Dresser and Louisa W. Dresser to Abraham Lincoln.

3Lincoln purchased these two lots from Elijah Iles in 1838 for $300. The lots were
                  across Eighth Street from his home in the middle of the block.Deed of Elijah Iles and Malinda Iles to Abraham Lincoln.
